item.title: Latest example of flytipping at this point by same person, 11th February
item.description:
I noted a large pellet delivery outside Grace Place about 10am adressed to the shop. By 3pm there was just a pellet outside the shop. At 530pm I noticed it flytipped across from the shop with a guy from the Acorn van milling around between the shop, the item and the van which was as usual parked across double yellow lines blocking a pedestrian crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Bagshot Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bag of rubbish dumped, 11th February
item.description:
I don't know if the church left it outside accidentally, or it was dumped outside the Freeman Ghananian Methodist church, but this has been sitting outside for a day or two and the bag looks like it is starting to get torn open by the foxes. Please can someone collect.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover loose, 11th February
item.description:
The manhole cover outside William Hill, 180 Jamaica Road is very loose, it seems to have been repaires with just tarmac pit over some of it, which hasn't helped at all. When a wide vehicle goes over it, ie. Lorry, bus, van, it makes a very loud sound which is a disturbance, it is in main busy road. More so during the night when the streets are fairly quiet, but has woken myself and neighbours, as it's very loud the best of times Please can this be repaired properly, as it has been reported and repaired several times (I believe), but the manhole cover keeps coming loose after time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected household rubbish - excessive amounts piling up, 11th February
item.description:
This household rubbish seems to be piling up and the bags are breaking down. It’s increasing rats spotted in area and I’m asking why it’s not being taken as usual?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14 - 16, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins missing/storage, 11th February
item.description:
Bins are missing at Anstridge Road flats opposite Anstridge Path. SE9 2LN. The bin locker opposite the youth centre is attracting youths smoking weed and urinating

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Anstridge Road, Avery Hill
